definition: to eat plain rice/(fig.) to eat and not pay for it/to sponge off others/to freeload
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: Our company will never afford (free lunch for )the unearned people.
sentences.chinese: 吃白饭，意为不劳而获，吃免费的午餐。

sentences.english: He likes to have rice and pickles for meals.
To eat plain rice or pasta without other dishes.
sentences.chinese: 他没有要炒菜，只吃白饭。

sentences.english: There are too much dead weight in the company, so things need to be streamlined.
sentences.chinese: 公司吃白饭的人太多了，所以要精简人员。

definition: to live as a parasite/doing nothing to earn one's keep
rice tub (from which cooked rice or other food is served)/(fig.) fathead/a good-for-nothing
wine sack, food bag (idiom); useless person, only fit for guzzling and boozing
to eat without paying/to eat for free
dog's leg/fig. one who follows a villain/henchman/hired thug
